question: When did Albert Einstein publish his theory of relativity?
context: Albert Einstein
Albert Einstein (1879-1955) was a German-born theoretical physicist.
He published the special theory of relativity in 1905.
The general theory of relativity was published in 1915.
Theory of Relativity
The theory of relativity revolutionized physics.
It consists of special relativity and general relativity.

question: What is the capital city of the country where the Eiffel Tower is located?
context: Eiffel Tower
The Eiffel Tower is located in Paris, France.
It was completed in 1889.
Paris
Paris is the capital city of France.
It is known as the City of Light.

question: Who wrote the novel that features the character Sherlock Holmes?
context: Sherlock Holmes
Sherlock Holmes is a fictional detective created by Arthur Conan Doyle.
The character first appeared in 1887.
Arthur Conan Doyle
Arthur Conan Doyle was a British writer.
He created the character Sherlock Holmes.

question: In which year did the company founded by Steve Jobs release its first iPhone?
context: Steve Jobs
Steve Jobs co-founded Apple Inc. in 1976.
He was the CEO of Apple until 2011.
Apple Inc.
Apple Inc. is a technology company.
The first iPhone was released in 2007.

question: What is the chemical symbol of the element discovered by Marie Curie?
context: Marie Curie
Marie Curie was a Polish-French physicist.
She discovered the elements polonium and radium.
Polonium
Polonium is a chemical element with symbol Po.
It was discovered by Marie Curie in 1898.

question: Which planet is closest to the Sun in our solar system?
context: Solar System
The solar system consists of the Sun and planets.
Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun.
Mercury
Mercury is the smallest planet in the solar system.
It orbits closest to the Sun.

question: What is the name of the longest river in the continent where the Amazon rainforest is located?
context: Amazon Rainforest
The Amazon rainforest is located in South America.
It is the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
Amazon River
The Amazon River is the longest river in South America.
It flows through the Amazon rainforest.

question: Who painted the artwork that features the Mona Lisa?
context: Mona Lisa
The Mona Lisa is a famous painting by Leonardo da Vinci.
It is displayed in the Louvre Museum in Paris.
Leonardo da Vinci
Leonardo da Vinci was an Italian Renaissance artist.
He painted the Mona Lisa between 1503 and 1519.

question: What is the capital of the country where Mount Everest is located?
context: Mount Everest
Mount Everest is located on the border between Nepal and China.
It is the highest mountain in the world.
Nepal
Nepal is a country in South Asia.
Kathmandu is the capital city of Nepal.

question: Which scientist formulated the laws of motion that describe planetary orbits?
context: Laws of Motion
The laws of motion were formulated by Isaac Newton.
They describe the motion of objects and planets.
Isaac Newton
Isaac Newton was an English physicist and mathematician.
He formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation.
